French PM's planned 2026 budget cuts could slow growth, experts say
description: Prime Minister François Bayrou's proposed €43.8 billion in budget cuts, aiming to reduce the public deficit to 4.6% of GDP, could undermine household consumption, stifling growth during a trade war and worsening inequality.

'Soldiers found us and told us to undress': In Ethiopia, silence shrouds Tigray war's mass rapes
description: During the war in Tigray, in Ethiopia, 120,000 women were victims of rape. More than two and a half years since the end of the conflict, many survivors are still trying to overcome their trauma, with justice yet to be served.

headline: Trump hosts Gulf leaders at White House amid bursts of violence in the Middle East
description: President Donald Trump hosted Bahrain's crown prince and is set to have dinner with Qatar's prime minister on Wednesday. Despite Trump's pledge to impose peace throughout the Middle East, scant progress has been made to curtail Israel's attacks on Gaza, while recent violence between Israel and Syria have only renewed doubts about the US president's diplomatic commitments.

headline: Kendrick Lamar and SZA deliver three-hour tour de force at Paris concert
description: The two leading figures of contemporary American rap and R&B have crafted a joint three-hour show for their Grand National Tour, which is stopping in Paris for two nights.

headline: 'His return was a miracle, but he had changed': The first free summer of Lyon's Holocaust survivors
description: 'The Summer of 1945' (3/6). As Lyon celebrated the Liberation, survivors of the death camps tried to reconnect with daily life, despite hardship, silence, and widespread incomprehension.

Xi: The father, the son and the party
description: Given that Xi Jinping's father was a reformer, should his son not have been one as well? In the first English-language biography of the Chinese president's father, the author sees within the current leader's conservatism the cultural mark of absolute devotion to the Chinese Communist Party.

headline: Photography, politics and protest collide at Rencontres d'Arles
description: The 56th Rencontres d'Arles opened with a 15% rise in attendance. But behind the packed halls and sold-out screenings, tensions flared over cries of cultural gentrification, uneven art shows and political protests.

headline: French PM bets on national effort against 'curse' of debt
description: On Tuesday, Prime Minister François Bayrou outlined the main strategies chosen to reach €43.8 billion in savings in the 2026 budget, all while carefully avoiding conflict with both his allies and the Socialists, on whom his survival depends.
